entry.title: 556: Facial Computing
entry.summary: Chris tries out Spatial Computing using a $3,200 trick, and Mike has a Rails treat you won't want to miss.

entry.title: 548: Uncomfortable Linux Truths
entry.summary: Some uncomfortable truths about using Linux, and then we introduce a new segment: Will it Nix?

entry.title: 555: It's Good to be the King
entry.summary: If you're going to come at the king, you better not miss; now it's Apple's turn to make everyone feel pain. And our spicy take on why AI saftey is really about stopping a movment.

entry.title: 547: Behind the Shelves
entry.summary: Data-hoard with purpose and manage your audiobooks and podcasts with one application, plus the lone Linux box that remains on Mars.

entry.title: 554: The App Store Addiction
entry.summary: We knew they'd be petulant, but even our expectations were higher than this. We dig into how Apple dunked on devs after last week's show, yet another Microsoft hack, and more.

entry.title: 546: What Youâ€™re Missing about NixOS
entry.summary: Trying NixOS can be fraught with complexity, half-completed guides, and boring videos. Even if you never plan to switch to NixOS, we invite you to come along for a hype-free ride that digs into one of the most rapidly developing areas of Linux.

entry.title: 553: Fake AI Until You Make AI
entry.summary: They are building AI into toilets now; CES was a clown show. But we put our business hats on and find the bright side. Plus, Epic's major loss to Apple that just rolled in, and where we think the next fight will be, and how developers can get ahead of it.

entry.title: 545: 3,062 Days Later
entry.summary: Kent Overstreet, the creator of bcachefs, helps us understand where his new filesystem fits, what it's like to upstream a new filesystem, and how they've solved the RAID write hole. Special Guest: Kent Overstreet.
